thread.title: Stacey Solomon bravely speaks out about abusive relationship - but clashes with Katie Price over how to cope with violence
thread.title_full: Stacey Solomon bravely speaks out about abusive relationship - but clashes with Katie Price over how to cope with violence

author: Kyle O'Sullivan
title: Stacey Solomon bravely speaks out about abusive relationship - but clashes with Katie Price over how to cope with violence
text:
Get celebs     
Loose Women viewers have praised Stacey Solomon for bravely speaking out about her abusive relationship. 
The panelist, who is now dating Joe Swash, revealed that you "feel like you're not the same person you were before" as she openly spoke about a past relationship. 
The discussion came after a woman in Birmingham asked police to release footage of a sustained attack on her by her partner to raise awareness. 
Stacey said: "I was in an abusive relationship and what it does is it makes you forget who you are. Read More Stacey Solomon reveals what stopped her from getting abortion at 17 as Coleen Nolan confesses she had one as a teen The panel were raising awareness for domestic violence against women 
"A part of you does feel like I'm never going to be the same person again and no matter what I do I'm always going to be this weird version of myself. 
"You can almost see what you used to be like. You can remember it, you get the feeling, you sometimes act how you used to act." 
Fellow host Katie Price who suffered through an abusive relationship herself said it was about "having the balls to leave", but Stacey hit back by saying it wasn't as easy as that. 
She added: "I don't think it's about having the balls. I think these people manipulate you in a way that makes that seem normal." Read More Viewers were quick to praise Stacey for her bravery Stacey and Katie Price disagreed about having the confidence to leave 
Viewers took to Twitter to heap praise on Stacey for bravely opening up about her past. 
One said: "Actually just want to give Stacy a hug, she looks like she's about to just burst into tears LooseWomen " 
Another added: "Aw @ StaceySolomon so brave for speaking out @ LooseWomen" 
A third said: "@StaceySolomon you should be so so proud of yourself and how far you have come! @loosewomen #loosewomen" Like us on Facebook
